targets.label: Enabled Targets
targets.comment: Logger will write only to enabled targets. To enable a Target, simply click on it. To enable multiple Targets, press CTRL and click on each Target.

target_map.label: Target Map
target_map.comment: Use Regular Expressions to specify which messages can be logged to each Target. If no rules are specified, all messages will be logged to all enabled Targets. Note: Priority Level filters are not affected by this setting.

priority.label: Default Priority Level Filter
priority.comment: Choose the lowest priority level to be logged. Can be overridden separately for each writer.

format.label: Advanced Format
format.comment:
"\n" will be replaced with a newline. Available keys:
%timestamp%
%priorityName%
%priority%
%storeCode%
%adminUserId%
%adminUserName%
%timeElapsed%
%hostname%
%requestMethod%
%requestUri%
%requestData%
%remoteAddress%
%httpHost%
%httpCookie%
%sessionData%
%httpUserAgent%
%file%
%line%
%message%
%backtrace%
%requestId%

filter_request_data.label: Filter Request Data
filter_request_data.comment: Data of the request arrays to be filtered for security reasons.

max_backtrace_lines.label: Max Backtrace Lines
max_backtrace_lines.comment: Enter a number above 0 to enable the %backtrace% key in the Advanced Format or in Graylog2

pretty_print.label: Pretty Print
pretty_print.comment: Pretty Print JSON encoded data (request data and session data). Requires PHP 5.4+

max_data_length.label: Max Data Length
max_data_length.comment: Max length of individual data fields.

add_session_data.label: Add Session Data
add_session_data.comment: If "Yes", session data will be added to event data.

use_queue.label: Queue Events
use_queue.comment: When set to "Yes", events will be grouped into a single event, which will be written at the end of each page processing.

frontend_logger.label: Frontend Logger
frontend_logger.comment:
When set to "Yes", JS errors in the frontend will be send to an action to send these errors also to the configured logging backend.
Note: only if client is not defined in dev/restrict/allow_ips

logglyhttps.label: Loggly (HTTPS) Configuration
logglyhttps.comment:
Sends log messages in JSON format to Loggly, using HTTPS protocol.
Important: HTTPS is very slow, therefore it should be used only if the log messages contain sensitive data. It's also recommended to enable this logger exclusively for critical log messages, and to enable Queue Events in General section, so that the messages are sent at the end of each page execution.

sentry.comment: Sends data to Sentry.

public_dsn.label: DSN
public_dsn.comment:
The DSN can be found in Sentry by navigating to [Project Name] -> Settings -> Client Keys (DSN). Its template resembles the following:
https://{PUBLIC_KEY}@{HOST}/{PROJECT_ID}

frontend_enabled.label: Enable Javascript Reporting for Frontend
frontend_enabled.comment: This will add the raven.js client script to the page so that frontend errors will be captured and transmitted to Sentry.io using the above Public DSN.

adminhtml_enabled.label: Enable Javascript Reporting for Admin
adminhtml_enabled.comment:
This will add the raven.js client script to the page so that adminhtml errors will be captured and transmitted to Sentry.io Public DSN.

You must add this code to your page/head.phtml adminhtml template:
<?php echo $this->getChildHtml('firegento_logger_sentry') ?>
